result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald A. Ross Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9:40 a.m. Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court, in custody, via video.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf15 and 15cf47. Also 14cm367, 14cf217, 15cf83. In 15cf15, Court/Michlig statement to time served. Court finds credit of 90 days in 15cf47 and grants an additional 2 days credit on Count 2 and Judgment of Conviction should be amended. In 15cf15, Court finds 14 days credit exists and Judgment of Conviction should be amended - 14 days credit is for revocation of probation not to be credited on current sentence. Adj. 9:49 a.m.

04:31 pm - Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Ronald A. Ross in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf83, 15cf47, 14cm367,14cm178 (RH), 15cf15 and 14cf217.  In case 14cm367 - State moves to Dismiss and Read In Counts 2 and 3 - Granted.  In Case 14cf217 - State moves to dismiss and read in Counts 3 through 6 - Granted.  In case 15cf15 - State moves to Dismiss but Read In Counts 2 and 3 - Granted.  In Case 15cf47 - State moves to dismiss but read in Coun1 - Granted.  In case 15cf83 - State moves to dismiss but read - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to all remaining counts.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Bennett/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
14cm367 - WHS/POP 2 yrs, Jail 45 days all but 14 days stayed with successful completion of OWI Court, W/Huber for all purposes, Fine $1694.00, DL Revocation 24 months, IID 12 months, Alcohol Assessment/Driver Safety Plan, Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
14CF217 - Count 1 - WSP 4 yrs - 2 yrs Initial Confinement, 2 yrs Extended Supervision - Imposed and Stayed - Probation 4 yrs - CC/Supervision Fees, Comply with all child support orders, Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Count 2 - WHS/POP 4 yrs, CC/Supervision Fees, Comply with child support orders, Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
15cf15 - WHS/POP 3 yrs, CC/Supervision Fees, May not possess or purchase pseudephedrine unless possession and/or purchase is pursuant to a valid prescription written for defendant, AODA assessment and recovery, Community Service 50 hours.
15cf47 Count 2 - Jail 1 yr W/Huber for all purposes - CS to 14cm367 - Jail credit 88 days
Count 3 - WHS/POP 4 yrs, CC/Supervision Fees, May not possess or purchase pseudephedrine unless possession and/or purchase is pursuant to a valid prescription written for defendant.
Appeal rights and NADVI given
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

08:36 an - Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Ronald A. Ross in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In 15cf83 and 15cf47 - Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information.  Bennett in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

09:05 am - Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Ronald A. Ross in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf15, 14cm367, 15cf83, 14cm178, 14cf217 and 15cf47.  Will proceed with AIA in case 15cf83.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing.
Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No contact with Andrea Healy, Debra Healy, Jake Weinstein or Richard Nitschke

Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court, via video  in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:39
In receipt, right to counsel - Bennett represents in underlying cases - request counsel on this case as well - defendant to contact PD's office  regarding new charges
Michlig to bail -  - Court sets $ cash bond -
Defendant statement - Court statement -  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
